title: PowerShell MCP Threat Analysis & Detection
body: PowerShell MCP Server provides comprehensive threat analysis and detection capabilities through threat-analysis tool. Returns statistics on totalUnknownCommands, uniqueThreats, highRiskThreats, aliasesDetected, sessionsWithThreats with detailed recent threat information including command frequency, first/last seen timestamps, possible aliases detection, and risk assessment. System maintains 61 known aliases and 18 suspicious patterns for command classification. Threat levels assessed as LOW/MEDIUM/HIGH with recommendations. Commands like 'dir', 'type', '$PSVersionTable' may be classified as UNKNOWN requiring confirmation. Includes session tracking with unique session IDs and server uptime monitoring. Use 'includeDetails: true' parameter to get comprehensive threat information for security analysis.
